section.p: A document issued by a medical practitioner certifying the deceased state of a person. In the United States, this is typically the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death (Rev. 11/2003).

ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] dateFiled with data type Point In Time
The date the Certificate of Death was filed with the Registrar.

Contains exactly one [1..1] didTobaccoUseContribute with data type Code
Indicates whether it is the opinion of the Medical Certifier that the use of tobacco contributed to he person's death. Possible values include: Yes, No, Probably, Unknown.

Contains zero or one [0..1] dispositionCategory with data type Code
Categories the method of the disposition of the body. Possible values include: Burial, Cremation, Donation, Entombment, Removal from State.

Contains zero or one [0..1] dispositionOther with data type String
A textual description of the method of the disposition of the body, when none of possible values of dispositionCategory applies (in other words, a description for "Other").

Contains exactly one [1..1] mannerOfDeath with data type Code
Categorizes the underlying cause of death. Possible values (from the US Standard Death Certificate, version 2003) include: Natural, Homicide, Accident, Suicide, Pending Investigation, Could not be Determined. For more details, see http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/misc/hb_cod.pdf

Contains exactly one [1..1] placeOfDeathCategory with data type Code
Categories the location of the person's death. Possible values include:</p><p>If death occured in a Hospital: Inpatient, Emergency Room/Outpatient, Dead on Arrival</p><p>If death occured somewhere other than in a Hospital: Hospice facility, Nursing home/Long term care facility, Decedent s home.

Contains exactly one [1..1] placeOfDeathOther with data type String
<p>A textual description of the place of death, when none of possible values of placeOfDeath applies (in other words, a description for "Other").</p>

Contains zero or one [0..1] pregnancyStatusCategory with data type Code
If the person is female, this property provides an indication of whether she was pregnant at or near the time of death. This information is important in determining pregnancy-related mortality. Possible values include: Not pregnant within past year, Pregnant at time of death, Not pregnant, but pregnant within 42 days of death, Not pregnant, but pregnant 43 days to 1 year before death, Unknown if pregnant within the past year.

Contains exactly one [1..1] survivingSpousesName with data type String
If the decedent was married at the time of death, this property contains the full name of the surviving spouse. If the surviving spouse is the wife, her name prior to first marriage should be entered. This item is used in establishing proper insurance settlements and other survivor benefits.

Contains exactly one [1..1] wasAutopsyFindingsAvailable with data type Boolean
If an autopsy was performed, this property indicates whether the autopsy findings were available to complete the cause of death. This property should be null (i.e., "blank") if no autopsy was performed.

Contains exactly one [1..1] wasAutopsyPerformed with data type Boolean
Indicates whether either a partial or full autopsy was performed.

Contains exactly one [1..1] wasEverInArmedForces with data type Boolean
Indicates whether the decedent was ever in the U.S. Armed Forces.

Contains exactly one [1..1] wasResidenceInsideCityLimits with data type Boolean
Indicates whether the decedent's residence is inside city limits.

Contains zero or one [0..1] informant, where its type is Informant
Identifies the person who informed the authorites of the decedent's death.

Contains zero or one [0..1] facilityAtDeath, where its type is Service Delivery Location
Place at which death occurred. If death did not occur at an institution, only the address is used. Note that the address includes County.

Contains zero or one [0..1] funeralFacility, where its type is Organizational Provider
Identifies the funeral facility, including license information.

Contains exactly one [1..1] pronouncementOfDeath, where its type is Pronouncement Of Death
The opinion or determination, based on a physical assessment, that life has ceased. A series of steps that need to occur to determine that a death has occurred. Involves examining patients to determine death, notifying families and in recording proper documentation of a death. Death pronouncements are generally conducted by a physician.

Contains zero or one [0..1] injury, where its type is Injury
Information related to cases where the decedents death was due to injury or poisoning.

Contains exactly one [1..1] certifier, where its type is Legal Authenticator
The practitioner who certified the information contained in the Certificate of Death
